content: Jerry Falwell's Legacy of Hate Lives On The Liberty Alliance, the fundamentalist Baptist group formerly run by Jerry Falwell, and now his son Jerry Falwell Jr., has issued an action alert urging followers to rail against the hate-crimes bill that would add sexual orientation, gender identity, and disability to the existing federal hate-crimes law. H.R. 1913, the "Local Law Enforcement Hate Crimes Prevention Act of 2009," will likely be brought before the full House of Representatives on Wednesday. Liberty's urgent alert reads, "It is critical that you contact your congressional representative immediately to let him or her know of your opposition to this dangerous legislation, which may form a legal basis to criminalize even a sermon or Bible reading as 'hate speech,' resulting in potential fines or even imprisonment of pastors, Sunday school teachers, youth leaders, Christian counselors, and religious broadcasters. >>http://www.advocate.com/news_detail_ektid79937.asp
reply: Jerry Falwell's Legacy of Hate Lives On The Liberty Alliance, the fundamentalist Baptist group formerly run by Jerry Falwell, and now his son Jerry Falwell Jr., has issued an action alert urging followers to rail against the hate-crimes bill that would add sexual orientation, gender identity, and disability to the existing federal hate-crimes law. H.R. 1913, the "Local Law Enforcement Hate Crimes Prevention Act of 2009," will likely be brought before the full House of Representatives on Wednesday. content: It would be nice if Jerry Falwell Jr. knew the difference between "Hate Speech" and "Hate Crimes" before he unleashes his minions to put a stop to Legislation he evidently doesn't understand. On the other hand, he probably is aware of the differences and doesn't want the truth getting in the way of his fear mongering, deceitful, anti-gay agenda.

content: I agree. Far too many people on both sides of the isles wish for others to simply "disappear off the face of the earth." That sounds kinda extremist to me. I don't wish that. I wish for JF JR. to have his rights, yet I don't want my rights up for a "vote." I don't think ANYONE'S rights should be the whim of the majority. There must be common ground here somewhere!

content: Falwell will be forgotten before long except in some narrow circles of hand wringing Xians who will still be waiting to be rescued by their unseen hero. There is a trail of dead religious loud mouths like him going way back. A few get published and republished but most are forgotten... as will he. But, others will step up to the plate to take swings at the general culture and its demise because it doesn't live up to some particular individual/groups assessment of religious imperatives. And so it goes. But, I have confidence in the power of the secular world over riding the control freaks of the religious world. The testimony of the world is greater than the testimony of Jesus. In the mean time, you just have to live with.

content: quote: Originally posted by 21194237: I like to think that the 'rights' of anyone extend only so far as they begin to encroach on the 'rights' of others. Sure is a lot of hate expressed here. Don't know much about Falwell, but what did he do besides teach Bible verses? The late Jerry Fawell disliked Gays & Lesbians to the point where he would attack anything remotely thought to be Gay. Take that Purple Teletubbie scandal where Fawell thought Tinky Winky was a Gay role model because he was purple, had triangle shaped antenna, and carried a magic bag that looked like a womans purse. He blamed the 9/11 attacks on abortionists, pagans, feminist, gays, & lesbians. He called the Metropolitan Community Church "brute beasts", and a vile satanic system because they allow gays & lesbians to worship the Christian God. He told a crowd in Florida that "gay folks would just as soon kill you as look at you". He regularly stated that AIDS is Gods punishment of gays & lesbians and the society that tolerates them. Are there Bible verses where God punishes gays & lesbians with diseases. Are there Bible verses that say churches which allow gays & lesbians to worship God are brute beast & vile. Are there Bible verses that suggest the color purple, triangles, or purses on a comical creation is to be avoided because it just might be gay in some way. Are there Bible verses that say gays & lesbians would "just as soon kill you as look at you". If there are Bible verses that say such things, then I'd be inclined to say "There sure is a lot of hate expressed in there".
quote: Originally posted by 21194237: I like to think that the 'rights' of anyone extend only so far as they begin to encroach on the 'rights' of others. Sure is a lot of hate expressed here. Don't know much about Falwell, but what did he do besides teach Bible verses?

He blamed the 9/11 attacks on abortionists, pagans, feminist, gays, & lesbians. He told a crowd in Florida that "gay folks would just as soon kill you as look at you". He regularly stated that AIDS is Gods punishment of gays & lesbians and the society that tolerates them. Are there Bible verses where God punishes gays & lesbians with diseases. Are there Bible verses that say churches which allow gays & lesbians to worship God are brute beast & vile. Are there Bible verses that suggest the color purple, triangles, or purses on a comical creation is to be avoided because it just might be gay in some way. Are there Bible verses that say gays & lesbians would "just as soon kill you as look at you". If there are Bible verses that say such things, then I'd be inclined to say "There sure is a lot of hate expressed in there".
title: Jerry Falwell's Legacy of Hate Lives On

content: quote: If there are Bible verses that say such things, then I'd be inclined to say "There sure is a lot of hate expressed in there". There is an element that is attracted to "authorized" hate, and Falwell was a major recruiter for that ilk. But, people are easily 'blinded by the light' when the Bible and God are mentioned and then tend to jump on any cause if those are evoked. Falwell was bad for Christianity. Just as a note, "Sodomite" was a biblical phrase that also included 'gluttons' and I believe Mr. Falwell filled that role as well.
quote: If there are Bible verses that say such things, then I'd be inclined to say "There sure is a lot of hate expressed in there".

content: quote: Originally posted by 21194237: <Snipped>... Falwell was a pastor and teacher of the Bible and I've heard him quote Bible scripture from both old & new testaments that tell of the sin of h o m o s e x u a l conduct. Falwell did not make it up. I have heard Falwell express love & forgiveness for all people and condemn only sin as defined in the Bible. Before you jump to defend someone's actions, you would do well to understand both the person and the source of his teachings. Falwell, Sr. was as devoted to hating anything related to homosexuals as he was to spreading his personal vision of a Christian nation no matter how much of the bible he had to twist around and he stooped to any level to bring people to his way of thinking. If you truly want to know the truth, study the etymology of the word "homosexual". You'll learn that the word didn't even exist in print until 1967. So how could it possibly have existed in a bible created over a thousand years ago? If you still don't believe, study the exact location of the word "homosexual" in any authoritative version. In the KJV, you'll only see that word in Corinthians. This chapter in the bible is not Jesus' teachings; it is Paul the Apostle ranting about what is wrong with the Christian church in Corinth. My studies have shown consistently that Paul was a busy-body that jumped at any opportunity to criticize others for falling short of Jesus' teachings. And for further perspective on the KJV, there were a number of scribes commissioned to translate the bible from Greek into what would become the King James version. The first 2 scribes were killed after submitting their work... Fortunately, the next scribe got the message and produced a translation that agreed with King James' line of thinking. Funny how the word of God doesn't seem to apply to those in power, huh? Or is it just that the ones in power define the word of God? Just a side note... Only 53 posts and you already know how to get around the profanity filter and which words to tap-dance around...? Not your only account here?
quote: Originally posted by 21194237: <Snipped>... Falwell was a pastor and teacher of the Bible and I've heard him quote Bible scripture from both old & new testaments that tell of the sin of h o m o s e x u a l conduct. Falwell did not make it up. I have heard Falwell express love & forgiveness for all people and condemn only sin as defined in the Bible.

title: Jerry Falwell's Legacy of Hate Lives On
